speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when these symptoms started? Was it sudden or did they develop over time?

speaker: Patient
text: "About 2 months ago, to be honest, I started feeling really tired all the time, like I couldn't get out of bed in the morning. It's been getting progressively worse, and I've also noticed that my skin has been feeling really itchy, especially on my arms and legs, and I've been scratching a lot."

speaker: Doctor
text: "When you say 'gradually', can you give me a timeframe of months or weeks? Was it a slow progression or more of a steady decline?"

speaker: Doctor
text:
"Ah, thank you for your detailed responses. I think I have a good understanding of your symptoms and medical history. Based on your presentation, I'm going to request one final test to confirm my suspicions. REQUEST TEST: Liver Biopsy.

I'm going to take a liver biopsy to examine the mass I saw on the ultrasound. This will give us more information about the nature of the mass and whether it's benign or malignant.

I want to reassure you that the biopsy is a relatively minor procedure and should not cause you any significant discomfort. I'll be using a local anesthetic to numb the area and make the process as comfortable as possible.

Once we have the biopsy results, we can discuss further treatment options and management strategies. But I want to emphasize that this is a crucial step in determining the best course of action for your care.

Can you please get ready for the biopsy procedure, and I'll explain the details to you in more detail?"
